poem:
### Heat and Echoes

Fire chokes the hills—  
Catalonia burns  
as Europe swelters.  
Elsewhere,  
Russia whispers  
through glowing screens—  
Revolution painted red,  
words like embers  
scorch the air,  
and truth  
wilts  
under the weight  
of a manufactured storm.  
Would that the rain  
were whispers  
of peace.
